pr_title: [KOGITO-2753] Processes: Remove model transformations from REST endpoint

timeline.message:
[KOGITO-2753] Processes: Remove model transformations from REST endpoint

Model interface extends MapOutput and MapInput interfaces
xxxTaskOutput classes implements MapOutput (generated code does not
longer need to invoke toMap when building HumanTaskTransition)
New methods toModel on InputModel and toOutput on Model
Add chechError to ProcessInstance
start, startFrom, transition and abort methods on ProcessInstance now
returns ProcessInstance to allow fluent usage
Modification on templates to use them (removing mapInput, mapOutput and
getModel)

timeline.bodyText:
I am not sure I like making all these methods fluent. The reason is that if we wanted at some point in the future to make any of those to return a value then we won't be able. We can make the code just as concise by using { pi.start(); pi.something() } etc. (notice the semicolon)
I know my original bug report included some fluent interfaces :P but not sure I want it for all. I am not sure I want it for some either at this point, because it would make the API asymmetrical.
timeline.author: evacchi

replies.bodyText:
Hmmmmmm,
Two statements in the same line is not a good idea, too confusing.
I agree on rationale to not make start methods fluent, but then we have to assume a longer generated code (which is probably fine anyway)
Regarding methods in processIntances that I change but are not start or abort, I think they can be fluent without compromising api consistency. lets analyze them individually:

updateVariables can return updated variables
checkError only makes sense if it returns ProcessInstance, if not, the  logic inside it (checking if there is any eeor)  should be make part of start method itself

replies.bodyText:
I think that reading a map and then using that map to fill the parameters of the class being created is very inneficient compared with direct attribute assignment.
The rule Im following to write generated code is to generate the code I will write as it was not generated at all, and if I were writting a method to create outputmodel from a model I would definitely  use getter an setters rather than toMap-fromMap.
This means, as you  pointed out, that fromMap-toMap are not longer used for bind-unbiding any longer. And I think that is for good...
toMap method is still used for human task transition.
fromMap can be probably removed, but I think this should be done in a different JIRA
replies.author: fjtirado

replies.bodyText: I think that reading and writing to a HashMap is basically a constant operation, but I also see your point. Bear in mind that toMap and fromMap are still used in generated bind/unbind methods of process instance, so we cannot remove them.
replies.author: MarianMacik
